history.content: This answer depends on what class you took and where--if you went to a CC in California or not, what requirement you are trying to fill... I recommend making an appointment with an advisor, that way they can work with you to find the best solution to your situation! If you cant make an appointment, try shooting advising an email!

This answer depends on what class you took and where--if you went to a CC in California or not, what requirement you are trying to fill... I recommend making an appointment with an advisor, that way they can work with you to find the best solution to your situation!

So I did something completely stupid and didn't fully read up on policies about taking classes at community college this summer. 

I just found out about this: "If you wish to take courses at another school during the summer (or in a semester that you are not enrolled at UC Berkeley), you must consult with your Engineering Student Services (ESS) Adviser before registering for the courses."

What would be the repercussions for not talking to my adviser before registering for classes? I did my best to look up transfer policies, etc but this was a huge oversight on my part :(
history.subject: Didn't consult my ESS adviser before taking summer CC classes?
